title: x/mobile/cmd/gomobile: code signing issue with Xcode 8
body:
Hello,

### What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
`go version go1.7.1 darwin/amd64`
`gomobile commit checksum #6ea0bb5`
`Xcode 8`

### What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
```
GOARCH="amd64"
GOBIN=""
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="darwin"
GOOS="darwin"
GOPATH="/Users/antoine/workspace_go"
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/usr/local/go"
GOTOOLDIR="/usr/local/go/pkg/tool/darwin_amd64"
CC="clang"
GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fno-caret-diagnostics -Qunused-arguments -fmessage-length=0 -fdebug-prefix-map=/var/folders/6v/sh_3nzrx4w92ky1806rt8ml00000gn/T/go-build155350486=/tmp/go-build -gno-record-gcc-switches -fno-common"
CXX="clang++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"
```

### What did you do?
I ran `gomobile build -target=ios -x golang.org/x/mobile/example/flappy`
It used to work with Xcode 7, but it started failing after I upgraded to Xcode 8.

FYI, I proceed as I used to do with Xcode 7 to obtain a signing identity: running a Swift app from Xcode to my phone in order to get a 7-day provisioning profile (Iâ€™m not subscribed to Apple developer program). That's how i used to get rid of code signing issues.

### What did you expect to see?
I expected to see gomobile build working (as it used to with XCode 7).

### What did you see instead?
I saw the build failing with the following error:
```
gomobile: xcrun xcodebuild -configuration Release -project /var/folders/6v/sh_3nzrx4w92ky1806rt8ml00000gn/T/gomobile-work-884184723/main.xcodeproj failed: exit status 65
=== BUILD TARGET main OF PROJECT main WITH CONFIGURATION Release ===

Check dependencies
Signing for "main" requires a development team. Select a development team in the project editor.
Code signing is required for product type 'Application' in SDK 'iOS 10.0'

** BUILD FAILED **
```

Please let me know if you need more information.

Regards,
Antoine
